description: Ms. codex. Title from text 1. Physical description: 17-21 lines per page; written in naskh in black on glazed, laid European paper. Catchwords and a few marginal notes. Damp-stained and a few repairs. Origin: Late 18th or early 19th century. All texts copied by Muḥammad (leaves 37b, 74a, etc.).
abstract: Collection of texts on Islamic rituals and related regulations from a Shiʻite perspective.
contents: 7. leaves 135a-166a: Risālah fī al-amwāt wa-mā yatbaʻuhā / Jaʻfar ibn Khaḍir al-Janājī.
extent: 166 leaves : paper ; 220 x 168 (170 x 98) mm bound to 220 x 171 mm
subject: Manuscripts, Arabic—New Jersey—Princeton
member_of_collections: Princeton Digital Library of Islamic Manuscripts
